case_vignette: A 21-year-old woman comes to the physician because of multiple painful, purulent ulcers she noticed on her vulva 2 days ago. The patient has not had fever or burning with urination. She has no history of similar lesions. She had a chlamydial infection at 17 years of age that was treated with antibiotics. Her immunizations are up-to-date. She is sexually active with her boyfriend of 2 months and uses an oral contraceptive; they use condoms inconsistently. Her temperature is 37.2°C (99.0°F), pulse is 94/min, and blood pressure is 120/76 mm Hg. Examination shows tender inguinal lymphadenopathy. There are 4 tender, purulent 1.5-cm ulcers with a necrotic base along the labia majora.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Infectious Diseases. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've noticed multiple painful sores with pus on my private area two days ago.
Have you had any fever, headache, or muscle aches?
No, I have not had fever or any other symptoms like headache or muscle aches.
Have you engaged in unprotected sexual activity recently?
Yes, I've been sexually active with my boyfriend for the past two months and we sometimes do not use condoms.
Do the sores look like blisters, and did they appear suddenly?
The sores aren't blisters; they're painful, pus-filled ulcers on my private area, and they appeared suddenly.
Do you have any swelling in your groin area, such as swollen lymph nodes?
Yes, I do have tender swelling in my groin area.
Have you or your boyfriend ever had similar symptoms before, or been diagnosed with a sexually transmitted infection (STI)?
I have no history of similar lesions before, but I did have a chlamydial infection when I was 17.
Have you noticed any unusual vaginal discharge or odor along with the sores?
No, I haven't noticed any unusual discharge or odor, just the sores.
Final Diagnosis: Genital herpes.
